src:
'Jedan od pet miliona' pita ko su bili ljudi u kordonima ispred RTS-a u vreme intervjua s Vučićem

07 Nov 2019, 12:05

Studenti iz Udruženja "Jedan od pet miliona" pitali su danas ko su ljudi koji su u utorak uveče u Beogradu, u vreme intervjua s predsednikom Srbije Aleksandom Vučićem za RTS, stojali u kordonima ispred ulaza u zgradu Televizije, a nisu imali službene legitimacije.Studentkinja Tea Vukadin upitala je ko su ljudi koji su napali studente te večeri i zašto Ministarstvo unutrašnjih poslova Srbije "ne radi svoj posao" da to istraži.Pokazala je fotografije ljudi koji su navodno napali studente, navodeći da je jedan od njih "Vukašin Bojović, sin Milana Bojovića koji je na inauguraciji predsednika Aleksandra Vučića tukao ljude"."Zašto policija nije ragovala odmah i privela ga?", pitala je Vukadin na konferenciji za novinare.Studentkinja Valentina Reković izjavila je da su TV-snimatelji i reporteri RTS-a bili na protestu i uzimali izjave od njih, ali da snimci nisu emitovani.Na pitanje novinara "da li su stvarno mislili da će uspeti da postave pitanje predsedniku" tako što bi ga sačekali pred zgradom, a služba bezbednosti to ne dozvoljava, Reković je rekla da su pojedini mediji njihovu najavu da će se okupiti ispred RTS-a nazvali "atentatom" na Vučića.
text:
'One in five million' asks who the people in the cordons were in front of RTS at the time of interview with Vucic

07 Nov 2019, 11:05

Students from the One in Five Million Association asked today who the people who stood in front of the entrance to the Television building in Belgrade during an interview with Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic on the RTS and did not have official IDs. Tea Vukadin asked who were the people who attacked the students that night and why the Serbian Ministry of Internal Affairs was "not doing her job" to investigate it. She showed photos of the people who allegedly attacked the students, stating that one of them was "Vukasin Bojovic, son Milan Bojovic, who beat people at the inauguration of President Aleksandar Vucic. "" Why did the police not immediately speak up and apprehend him? "Vukadin asked at a news conference. Student Valentina Rekovic said that RTS TV cameramen and reporters were on protest and took statements from them, but that the footage was not broadcast. When asked by reporters "did they really think they would be able to question the president" by g while waiting in front of the building and the security service does not allow it, Rekovic said that some media had called their announcement that they would gather in front of RTS to be "assassination" of Vucic.
